{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3570739,"name":"Nick Connor","username":"cnnrnck","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T00:52:04.445Z","cooked":"

We are running into a weird issue with using a remote CANcoder for motion control on our Algae intake/holding mechanism.

Below about 0.13 turns, the CANcoder is reading our position correctly, but the motor controller thinks it is at 0 turns. It will spike briefly up to the correct position when we move the mechanism, but then jumps back down to 0 turns. Above 0.13 turns, the motor controller has the same position as the CANcoder.

Additionally, when we give a motion magic request to set the motor to a certain position, the motor doesn’t even try to move if it is below the 0.13 turns, but if we lift it up to 0.13 turns, it suddenly moves to the position that was requested.

The Coral subsystem is set up in an almost identical way, but is not having this issue.

Here are some graphs from Phoenix Tuner that show the issues. Here is the graph of the absolute encoder:

PXL_20250328_0023249881920×1442 181 KB

Here is a graph over the same time period from the motor controller:

PXL_20250328_0023009331920×1442 203 KB

Here are some links to our repository:

Constants header file where the motor and CANcoder configs are set up: Contants.h

Algae subsystem: AlgaeSubsystem.cpp

Any help would be appreciated!

Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T02:59:01.906Z","cooked":"

This looks like a potentially faulty encoder; I’ve never seen this type of behavior and we use these all the time. I’d recommend contacting CTRE.

Do you watch the light on the encoder while this happens? Any chance you are somehow lifting away from the magnet’s happy zone?

Do you factory config your motors at start up? Maybe check if you have a soft limits enabled on your motor.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-28T03:02:01.149Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497180,"topic_slug":"remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60/497180/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3570971,"name":"Nick Connor","username":"cnnrnck","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T04:37:58.964Z","cooked":"

This was totally it. We confirmed it by moving the CANcoder slightly out of range and then twisting the shaft. The CANcoder still reported a position but the motor controller position dropped to 0, just like we were seeing when it was fully seated. Something with the mechanism must just be slightly moving the CANcoder out of range when the angle gets down below 0.13 and then it drops out. At starting position (0.25 turns), the light indicates it’s fine, so it has to be something with how the mechanism is moving at low angles.

Thanks for your help!

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-28T04:38:30.814Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":70,"readers_count":69,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497180,"topic_slug":"remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60","display_username":"Nick Connor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3691 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60/497180/4","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3570973,"name":"Nick Connor","username":"cnnrnck","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T04:40:21.698Z","cooked":"

That’s what we were thinking, but it turns out that as the mechanism gets to a low angle, it must make the CANcoder move slightly out of range from the magnet. When that happens, the CANcoder still reports a position (even if it is slightly inaccurate), but the position from the motor controller drops to 0.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-28T04:40:21.698Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":18.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497180,"topic_slug":"remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60","display_username":"Nick Connor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62698,"username":"CakeDeer6","name":"Ethan Grieshop","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3691 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60/497180/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3571031,"name":"Griffin Della Grotte","username":"Griffin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/griffin/{size}/5624_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T09:51:21.391Z","cooked":"

That… really doesn’t seem like it should be the intended behavior of the RemoteCANCoder setup. You’re saying that when the CANCoder reports out-of-range, and you check the position of the TalonFX configured with RemoteCANCoder, it will change its reported position to zero?

That’s gotta be a bug - surely you’d want it just to retain the last valid reported position from the RemoteCANCoder. @daltzsmith @Jacob_C

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-28T09:51:21.391Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497180,"topic_slug":"remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60","display_username":"Griffin Della Grotte","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65472,"username":"cnnrnck","name":"Nick Connor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e19b73/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Drive Coach 5940"},"post_url":"/t/remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60/497180/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3571046,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T11:18:07.438Z","cooked":"

It doesn’t really matter what position the Talon FX reports in this scenario; if the CANcoder LED goes red or completely disappears, we disable all closed-loop control and trip any enabled soft limits. Reporting 0 makes it obvious something has gone wrong, but we could change that.

Regardless, in this case you should see a Remote Sensor Data Invalid fault.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-28T11:18:07.438Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497180,"topic_slug":"remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60","display_username":"Benjamin Hall","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16726,"username":"Griffin","name":"Griffin Della Grotte","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/griffin/{size}/5624_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60/497180/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3571051,"name":"Griffin Della Grotte","username":"Griffin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/griffin/{size}/5624_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T11:22:00.523Z","cooked":"
bhall-ctre:

If the CANcoder LED goes red or completely disappears, we disable all closed-loop control and trip any enabled soft limits.

Ah, that makes sense! I guess from a mechanism standpoint it would be good for the rest of the code to still be able to figure out what the most recent position of the mechanism was, but definitely agree the downstream effects are limited if the control is already disabled. Thanks for the insight!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-28T11:22:17.835Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497180,"topic_slug":"remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60","display_username":"Griffin Della Grotte","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Drive Coach 5940"},"post_url":"/t/remote-cancoder-sensor-position-dropping-out-on-kraken-x60/497180/8","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3571154,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T14:03:25.286Z","cooked":"

Does this differ depending on whether or not fused cancoder is used versus synced? Any way to “seed” the last known good position if a magnet drops out of range or you lose a cancoder for whatever reason? Sorry for semi-tangent. For some reason I thought this was already something that happens by default if you’re running Pro and using a fused cancoder but could be totally making it up in my head
